StoryText: It's Thursday and %FullName:NPC:1% asks me, "What's going on for Saturday morning?"
Question: What do I say?

OptionText.Text: "Letâ€™s go see that new action comedy movie."
"We should do whatever you want to do."

OptionResult.Result: %FullName:NPC:1% gets angry with me because we already had plans to visit %Pron:1:2% family on Saturday.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: %FullName:NPC:1% is so mad at me because I clearly forgot the plans we already made for Saturday but on top of that I was being selfish and picking something that I was interested in but that %Pron:1:1% wasn't interested in. Yeah, I can't blame %Pron:1:2%. That was so dumb! Why did I say that?!

OptionResult.Result: %FullName:NPC:1% is mad at me because we already made plans and now it is clear I forgot.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: %FullName:NPC:1% wasn't asking me what we should do, %Pron:1:1% wanted to know when we should plan on leaving for the plans we already made. And here I thought I was being sly and letting %FullName:NPC:1% pick what we do. %Pron:1:1% already picked our plans a week ago! Oh man, I'm going to pay for this one.

OptionResult.Result: %FullName:NPC:1% is glad I want to wake up early because apparently we already made plans for Saturday that I forgot about.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: I dodged a bullet! I totally forgot we made plans for Saturday already. And I couldn't think of anything to say besides, "Waking up early" but %FullName:NPC:1% was very happy that I planned to wake up early in order to get ready and leave the house early! In actuality, I assumed we would make some other plans and I didn't remember these plans we made. Will I tell %FullName:NPC:1% this? NO WAY!
